cyclone.name: CLAUDETTE
cyclone.current_location: about 310 miles south of Morgan City, Louisiana
cyclone.trajectory: moving north toward the north-central Gulf Coast, then forecast to arc northeast across the southeastern United States and reach the Mid-Atlantic (including Virginia) late Sunday into Monday
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: near Morgan City, Louisiana (north-central Gulf Coast)

weather_observation.watch_coast: Intracoastal City, Louisiana to the Okaloosa/Walton County line, Florida including Lake Pontchartrain, Lake Maurepas, and metropolitan New Orleans
weather_observation.warning_coast: Same as watch area (Tropical Storm Warning)
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Northern Gulf Coast from Louisiana eastward to the western Florida Panhandle, then inland across MS, AL, GA and into the Carolinas and Virginia
weather_observation.wind: Breezy conditions likely with sustained winds 20–30 mph and occasional gusts near 35 mph as the remnant low passes.
weather_observation.storm_surge: None expected along the Virginia coast from this system.
weather_observation.rainfall: 1–3 inches of rainfall possible with locally higher amounts, leading to ponding on terminals and minor drainage issues.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Isolated brief tornadoes cannot be ruled out on the southern and eastern flank of the remnant low as it crosses Virginia late Sunday.
